conclusion: Identify the objects: Object A is a checkered cloth, Object B is a blue patterned cloth, Objects C, D, E, and F are blocks of different colors.
Consider the movement: Objects A and B are moving through the air and are placed down at the location of objects C, D, E, and F.
Due to gravity, objects A and B will come into contact with objects C, D, E, and F when placed down.
Cloth A (checkered) on Blocks C and D may drape over the blocks, partially covering them, and the blocks may remain in place with the cloth resting on top.
Cloth B (blue patterned) on Blocks E and F may drape over the blocks, partially covering them, and the blocks may remain in place with the cloth resting on top.
The cloths (A and B) will rest on top of the blocks (C, D, E, and F), partially covering them due to gravity.

Final answer: When objects A and B are placed down at the location of objects C, D, E, and F, they will come into contact with the blocks due to gravity, and the cloths will drape over the blocks, partially covering them.
